questions.description: Call for can mean require.

questions.question: We had to call ................................ a doctor because dad complained of uneasiness.
questions.description: To call somebody in is to get them to pay a visit.

questions.question: He has a short fuse but he calms ................................... fairly quickly.
questions.description: To calm down is to stop being angry.

questions.question: I don't care .............................. fish or meat. I eat veggies whenever possible.
questions.description: To care for something is to like it.

questions.question: She got carried ..................................... when she heard that she was the winner.
questions.description: To get carried away is to get so emotional that you lose control.

questions.question: They hoped that the new government would carry the infrastructure projects ....................................
questions.description: To carry something forward is to make it progress.

questions.question: The party carried ................................ into the night.
questions.description: Carry over can mean continue past a certain point.

questions.question: In spite of the opposition, the government carried .................................. the reforms.
questions.description: To carry through is to complete successfully.

questions.question: Why are you always cutting .................................... on my conversations?
questions.description: To cut in is to interrupt someone who is speaking.

questions.question: The hamlet is cut ................................... from the other human settlements in the area.
questions.description: If something is cut off, it cannot be accessed easily.

questions.question: Her relationship with her family is falling ....................................
questions.description: To fall apart is to break into parts.

questions.question: If his career in the show business does not take off, he always has his professional degrees to fall ......................................
questions.description: To fall back on something is to use it when nothing else works.

questions.question: We drove home to get ................................... from the crowd.
questions.description: To get away is to escape a place.

questions.question: It took her quite some time to get .......................................... her loss.
questions.description: To get over something is to stop feeling bad about something terrible that has happened in the past.

questions.question: The newly opened restaurant is giving ......................................... free coupons.
questions.description: To give away is to distribute.

questions.question: The task was so arduous that I gave .......................................... fairly quickly.
questions.description: To give up is to stop trying.

questions.question: I was so excited when he invited me to go .......................................... with him.
questions.description: To go out with somebody is to have a romantic date with them.

questions.question: She held ........................................ her disappointment.
questions.description: To hold back your feelings is to hide them.

questions.question: A good owner must be able to call ......................................... their dog.
questions.description: To call off a dog is to stop the animals from behaving aggressively.

questions.question: It is important to abide .............................. the rules and regulations.
questions.description: To abide by a rule is to respect it.

questions.question: I hope you can account ........................... the money you spent on that expensive vacation.
questions.description: To account for is to explain.

questions.question: Her explanations just do not add ............................
questions.description: When explanations add up, they make sense.

questions.question: The old man advised me ............................. walking alone after sunset.
questions.description: To advise against something is to recommend not doing it.

questions.question: Do you agree .................................. the opinion that education should be free for all?
questions.description: When you agree with something, you have the same opinion.

questions.question: We must allow .................................. potential problems that can delay the completion of the project.
questions.description: To allow for something is to take that into consideration.

questions.question: The idea of spending an afternoon at the beach just does not appeal ............................... me.
questions.description: If something appeals to you, you find it attractive or interesting.

questions.question: When the child saw the snake, he backed ................................... in fright.
questions.description: To back away is to move backwards in fear.

questions.question: The protesters forced the government to back .................................. on its attempts to demolish the old fort.
questions.description: To back down is to withdraw or concede defeat.

questions.question: When I was in trouble, there was no one to back me ................................
questions.description: To back somebody up is to give them support.

questions.question: Why are you blowing ................................. at me when it is not my fault?
questions.description: To blow up at somebody is to get angry with them.

questions.question: Riots have broken ................................ in parts of the country.
questions.description: When a riot breaks out, it starts suddenly.

questions.question: The woman broke ……………………… in the middle of her speech.
questions.description: Break down can mean cry.

questions.question: Please blow ……………………….. the candle.
questions.description: To blow out is to extinguish.

questions.question: At last the storm has blown …………………………
questions.description: Blow over can mean subside.

questions.question: The opposition parties are planning to bring ………………………… a No-Confidence Motion against the Prime Minister.
questions.description: To bring something forward is to introduce it for discussion.

questions.question: The accused said that he couldn't call …………………………. the whole events.

questions.description: To call off something is to cancel it.

questions.question: The investigators tried to call ………………………….. crucial information from him.

questions.description: To bring out is to publish.

questions.question: The scheme fell ………………………….. for want of support.

questions.description: To cut down on something is to reduce it.

questions.description: To turn something down is to decline it.

questions.question: He slowed ................................ the car as if he was about to stop.
questions.description: To slow down is to reduce speed.

questions.description: To dress down is to wear simple clothes.

questions.question: I don't want you to bring ........................... that topic again.

questions.question: The teacher asked the boy to do the exercise .............................
questions.description: To do something over is to repeat it.

questions.description: To fill up a bottle is to fill it to capacity.

questions.description: To do something behind someone's back is to do something without their knowledge.

questions.question: Although he deserved the job, his application was turned ..............................

questions.question: We should not throw .................................. anything useful.
questions.description: To throw something away is to discard it.

questions.description: To take something back is to withdraw a statement.

questions.question: Be careful. He might try to take you ………………………
questions.description: To take somebody in is to cheat them.

questions.question: She was not capable of taking her children ……………………… hand

questions.question: You must take your shoes ……………………… before entering the temple.
questions.description: To take a piece of clothing off is to remove it.

questions.description: To take on is to accept.

questions.question: I know you had a bad day at work, but you can’t take it ……………………….. on me.

questions.description: To take to somebody is to start to like them.

questions.question: He quit his corporate job to take …………………….. farming.

questions.description: To hang out is to spend time relaxing and enjoying yourself.

questions.question: Hang ………………………. ! I am coming.

questions.question: He is a cut ……………………….. the rest.
